page.title: 03St Brannock's Church.
page.content: Brannock decided to build a church in {550}A.D.He started work on the top of a hill over looking the present church. His men started work, and the legend says that every time he built it, it kept falling down the hill,so he gave up and started to build it on flat land .The church you see today was built by the year{1300}.About another 300 years later{a Ms Deborah {Keene}was buried: she was probably the first person to be buried in the graveyard. Over{3000}people attend church in a year,and it costs over {Â£21,000}to run it.The ages of people going to church are spread between the youngest babies and the eldest pensioners.The vicar when interviewed,said that his job was rewarding (but not in the sense of money) and that he likes teaching people about Jesus.
